examples: I was just, I was petrified.
I'm just petrified.

I just get petrified during these events.

examples: These days, alchemy gets a bad rap.

Chinese alchemy was tied into ideas about the earth itself.

examples: Alcoholism surged.

examples: And it's lunacy to separate them.

examples: Lunar dust is worse than glitter.

The dog is running around like a lunatic.

examples: It's up to the vice president, and we're not trying to usurp his authority in any way.

examples: Moving to a new country for college was daunting, but thanks to the likes of Skype and WhatsApp, my parents were always a phone call away.
Peter had put off mowing the lawn for so long that the job seemed daunting, but after starting at one corner, he soon finished the whole yard.
Being part of a union that's working with one of the most powerful corporations in the world, it can be daunting.
Building a small business might feel daunting at first.
But it is always daunting to meet, and who is the biggest hero you've ever met?
words.defineEn: to cause a person to feel intimidated, scared, or unconfident
words.defineVi: để gây ra một người cảm thấy bị đe dọa, sợ hãi, hoặc không tự tin

examples: Learning a new language can be a daunting task, but by practicing a little every day, you'll make steady progress, and eventually, little strokes fell great oaks, and you'll be fluent.
For minorities, the numbers can be even more daunting.
And it's a daunting thought.
For many parents the back to school season has never felt more daunting as we all adjust again to the realities of schooling during COVID-19.
It's a daunting task, one that will set up a more ambitious exploration of the Red Planet.
words.defineEn: intimidating, challenging, or overwhelming in a way that creates a sense of fear or unease

examples: The professor's handwriting on the whiteboard was messy and unintelligibly scribbled, making it challenging for the students to read and follow the notes.
Deciding to make trouble for the king instead, they scribbled a new note.
You know that you might as well be scribbling with an empty straw.
She concocts a fictional sister who's stuck at home, snatching time to scribble a few pages before she finds herself betrothed and runs away.

In the schools, scribes studying from dawn to dusk, from childhood well into adulthood.
Once the Library’s scribes had duplicated the texts, they kept the originals and sent the copies back to the ships.
Peseshet’s son Akhethetep is hard at work copying documents as part of his training to become a scribe.
Well, the Babylonian and Sumerian scribes who wrote these used to be basically no system.
Inside, the House of Life is bustling as usual with scribes, priests, doctors, and students.
words.defineEn: someone employed to make written copies of documents and manuscripts
